intro: Malouetia africana, commonly known as the African malouetia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature. Malouetia africana is often found in forest margins and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
